alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mississippi, southwestern Pemiscot and southeastern Dunklin Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hornersville, or 7 miles northwest of Gosnell, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gosnell, Steele, Hornersville, Cooter, Deering, Holland, Bragg City, Calumet, Woodland Corner, Rives, Hornersville Junction, West Hermondale, New Survey, Vincit, Gilbert, Denton, Gobler, Covington, Tinkerville and Shade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and southeastern Missouri.
